name: fofi
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(c1, c0, c2)), wcel(c2, cfn))

stmt.origin: syldan(wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(c1, c0, c2), wcel(c2, cfn), wbr(c2, cdom, c0))
stmt.pretty: syldan(c0 ∈ Fin, (c1 : c0 ↠ c2), c2 ∈ Fin, c2[≼]c0)

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(c1, c0, c2)), wcel(c2, cfn))

-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c2, cdom, c0)), wcel(c2, cfn))

comment: If a function has a finite domain, its range is finite. Theorem 37 of [Suppes] p. 104. (Contributed by NM, 25-Mar-2007.)
